intro: Phyllanthus pacificus var. uahukensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Hawaii. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, waxy leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. It plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance.
